title: Tom Cruise as Ironman - Deepfake Theater

constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

description: Years after the release of Iron Man in 2008, rumours persisted that Tom Cruise had been set to play Tony Stark, the role immortalised by Robert Downey Jr., in the 2008 blockbuster directed by Jon Favreau. In August 2019, Deepfake Theater couldn’t resist the urge to ‘magic up’ an alternate version of Iron Man’s trajectory through the Marvel Cinematic Universe in a video that employed deepfake technology to superimpose Cruise over scenes shot with Robert Downey Jr. across the gamut of Marvel Studios’ back catalogue.
